comments:
The console output produced by AllBuildTests in the infrastructure project 
(monitoring the tests that it finds) and several tests in 
conman.loader.shrike/tests/cases/org/eclipse/cme/conman/tests/usingloaders 
should instead be directed to a file (or files).

When we discussed, we decided this file (or files) could be under a cme 
directory in the user's temporary directory ("java.io.tmpdir"). 
cme/org.eclipse.cme.util/DirectoryManager contains a method for accessing the 
temporary directory. But see below...

FileBasedTestCase in cme tests/harness contains a setStreams(..) method for 
redirecting standard output and error. It is used to send them to files under 
the test output directory (getResultDir()), which goes under the project 
output directory (getResultRoot()), which is usually "zresults" under the 
project containing the test. This zresults directory is essentially a per-
project temporary directory for testing purposes, and tests.log gets written 
under it recording tests run on that project. Perhaps it would be a better 
place to put these logs? Take your pick!

I stole some code from FileBasedTestcase.  We now output log files for these
tests to zresults/*.log.  The console looks much neater after a test run !

Thanks! But when I run I still get the output below. The top part is from 
AllBuildTests itself; I'm not sure where the bottom part is from. I think both 
would be best in the new log files. I believe I have everything in sync, but 
perhaps I have done something wrong.

I only stopped console output from the serialization and AspectJ related tests.
We can take it further and log all output as Harold says.  Besides the output
from the AllBuildTests harness, the other output:

Key=aKey, value=[aValue]
Key=dKey, value=[dValue1, dValue2]
Key=aKey, value=[aValue]

appears to come out of:

TestMultivaluedTreeMap.testSubMaps() where it calls 'printMapEntries()'

cc: to Matt to handle the first part of this, to get AllBuildTests to log its
output rather than print it.
